activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10756
activity.text:
> > > > @Jacobjeevan Can you please provide screen recording?
> > > > Edit: Isn't it fine if we have the different option for switching camera? Because we are only selecting camera here. Won't it be congested or confusing if we merge this functionality with it?
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Try to think from a user's perspective - when they select a different camera, what should be the expected behavior? Does it make sense to continue showing front camera if I have selected to back camera?
> > > az_recorder_20250423_120350.mp4
> > 
> > 
> > I am able to think two approaches for this:
> > ```
> > 1. We can filter out the the camera according to their facingmode(like whether it is front camera or back camera). And then we can show camera according to the facing mode to the user.
> > 
> > 2. Another approach is we can merge the switching functionality but I think it will be very confusing for the user to select the camera.
> >    Is there any other way I can do it? @Jacobjeevan
> > ```
> 
> Not sure why it would confusing - if anything current approach would be confusing 😅
> 
> Anyways, do one thing: create a kebab/3-dot menu (similar to what you see in google meet for example) that has both switch camera and set preferred camera as options.
> 
> Switch camera can do the current switch functionality while set preferred camera would open up a dialog with the dropdown menu which we currently have (also add save button to make it clear).
> 
> Ofc, remove the dropdown menu and switch button from current screen.

But won't it still be the same? We are just changing UI. The device list will show all the camera(front and back) and user can select front camera as preferred camera while having facing mode as back.🤔
We can do one more thing, isn't it possible to filter camera on the basis of facing mode? @Jacobjeevan

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10756
activity.text:
> > @Jacobjeevan Can you please provide screen recording?
> > Edit: Isn't it fine if we have the different option for switching camera? Because we are only selecting camera here. Won't it be congested or confusing if we merge this functionality with it?
> 
> Try to think from a user's perspective - when they select a different camera, what should be the expected behavior? Does it make sense to continue showing front camera if I have selected to back camera?
> 
>  az_recorder_20250423_120350.mp4

I am able to think two approaches for this: 
1. We can filter out the the camera according to their facingmode(like whether it is front camera or back camera). And then we can show camera according to the facing mode to the user.
2. Another approach is we can merge the switching functionality but I think it will be very confusing for the user to select the camera.
Is there any other way I can do it? @Jacobjeevan

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10361
activity.text:
> > [@rithviknishad](https://github.com/rithviknishad) I think it is a state management issue as when I am continuously changing values, it is showing anonymous behavior. Sometimes the wrong value is getting replaced by the random values between 1-31 for days and 1-12 for months. There may be some other issue also which I am missing. I am working on it.
> 
> date-field is expecting user to type in 2 digit values for month (handleMonthChange doesn't change anything if there's only one digit).
> 
> To fix this, you can modify the logic in handleMonthChange to pad newMonth before the conditional checks. Also given that form doesn't allow submission when month > 12 (barring the padding issue above), I don't think any additional error handling is needed.
> 
> Edit: handleMonthChange is also the reason why you are able to submit the form after going back and entering 122 in the month column (month isn't changed within form value, instead submitted with previous value).
> 
> Edit: The auto focus to next cell causes an issue here, hmm let me see.

I have also tried onFocus and onInput event handlers to clear the values but it is not working.
